description: Ethan's list of resources for learning more about browser fingerprinting and more.

links.name: Cover Your Tracks by the Electronic Frontier Foundation
links.quote: Cover Your Tracks analyzes how well your browser and add-ons protect you against online tracking techniques.

links.name: CreepJS by Abraham Juliot
links.quote: The purpose of this project is to shed light on weaknesses and privacy leaks among modern anti-fingerprinting extensions and browsers.

links.name: IP addresses by KhanAcademy
links.quote: The Internet Protocol (IP) is one of the core protocols in the layers of the Internet, as you might guess from its name. It's used in all Internet communication to handle both addressing and routing.

links.name: IP addresses and DNS by KhanAcademy

links.quote: This RFC introduces domain style names, their use for Internet mail and host address support, and the protocols and servers used to implement domain name facilities.

The goal of domain names is to provide a mechanism for naming resources in such a way that the names are usable in different hosts, networks, protocol families, internets, and administrative organizations.

links.name: Browser detection using the user agent
Detecting Microsoft Edge from your website
links.quote: Soon the User-Agent string will be frozen and deprecated by various browsers.

links.name: "software threads vs hardware threads" on StackOverflow
